ab.title: Genesis 34
ab.l: And Dinah, daughter of Leah, whichshe bore to Jacob, went out to see the daughters of the land.
And when Shechem, son of Hamor, the Hivite, the princeof the country, saw her, he took her, and lay with her, and tormentedher.
And his soul clung to Dinah, daughterof Jacob, and he loved the girl, and spoke to the heartof the girl.
And Shechem said to Hamor,his father, saying, ‘Get me this girlfor a wife.’
And Jacob heard thathe had defiled Dinah, his daughter. And his sons werewith his livestock in the field. And Jacob kept quiet until they came.
And Hamor, father of Shechem, went out to Jacobto speak with him.

And the sons of Jacob camefrom the field when they heard it, and the men were very annoyed,and they became very angry because he had done a repulsivething among Israel, to lie with Jacob’s daughter and such a thing is not done.And Hamor spoke with them,saying, ‘The soul of my son Shechem loves your daughter.Give now her to him for a wife.
Andmake marriages with us: and give your daughters to us, andtake our daughters for yourselves.
And with usshall you dwell: and the land shall be before you. Dwelland trade in it and get possessions in it.’
And Shechem said to her father and to her brothers, ‘Let me findfavour in your eyes, and I will give whatever you say to me.
Go on asking me for dowry and gifts,and I will give whatever you shall say to me, and give me thegirl for a wife.’
And the sons of Jacob answeredShechem and Hamor, his father, deceitfully,and spoke, because he had defiled Dinahtheir sister.

And they said to them,‘We cannot do this thing, to giveseg type="commented" n="#seg023"/our daughter our sisteranchor type="commented" xml:id="seg023"/ to one who has a foreskin, because that is a disgraceto us.
Only on this |condition| will we bargain with you:if you will become like us, |in that| every male among you be circumcised.
And we will give our daughtersto you, and we will take your daughters to us, andwe will dwell with you, and we will become one people.
But if you do not listen to us, to be circumcised,then we will take our daughter, and we will go.’
And their words seemed good in Hamor’s eyes,and in the eyes of Shechem, Hamor’s son.

And the young man did not delay to do the thing, because he loved the daughterof Jacob. And he was more honourable than all the house of his father.And Hamor and Shechem, his son, came to the gateof their city, and spoke with the men of their city,saying,

‘These menare peaceable with us. And they shall dwell seg type="commented" n="#seg024"/there in |the| landanchor type="commented" xml:id="seg024"/, andtrade there. Lo, the land is spaciousbefore them. We will take their daughters to usfor wives. And we will give them our daughters.
Only this way will the men bargain with us,to dwell with us, to be one people: ifevery male among us is circumcised, as they are circumcised.
Their crowds and their propertyand all the livestock: they are, lo, ours. Only let us bargainwith them, and they shall dwell with us.’
Andto the word Hamor and to Shechem his son listenedall who went out of the gate of his city. And every male was circumcised,all that went out of the gate of his city.
And it was on thethird day, when they were sore, andtwo of the sons of Jacob, Simeon and Levi, Dinah’s brothers,took each man his sword, and came against the city calmly,and slew every male.
Andthey slaughtered Hamor and Shechem, his son,with the edge of the sword, and took Dinah from Shechem’s house,and went out.
The sons of Jacob had come upon the slain,and plundered the city, because they had defiledtheir sister.
They took their sheep,and their cattle, and their donkeys, and that which was in the city, andthat which was in the field.
And they captured all their possessions,and all their infants, and their wives,and plundered all that was in the house.

And Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, ‘You have destroyed me, making mean enemy among the inhabitants of the land, among the Canaanites,and among the Perizzites, and I am people few in number. And if they gather themselves againstme, they will kill me, and I will be destroyed, both I and myhousehold.’
And they said, ‘Shall he treatour sister like a harlot?’
